name: art'otel budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like boutique style clean lines and crisp decor this is the place for you. Spent 3 nights there on a great deal through Hotelconnect.co.uk ( I can't recommend these enough) Go for room in old buildings , spacious though you won't get a Danube view in these. Breakfast fine. Great location-about 5 mins walk to Chain Bridge and just next door, The Old Sailor pub with good selection of food and drink-otherwise a few restaurants locally. Didn't get a chance to try in-house spa....
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights for my husbands birthday and were thrilled with it.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: It is a great little hotel with friendly staff and good food. The location is great too as you can walk to many attraations, there is a metro station close by and there are tram stops right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic value along the Danube!!!
Not Good - Credit Card Fraud - Be Careful
reviews.text: The room was very clean and we had a great view of the river. A very pleasant hotel and I would definitely stay again.

reviews.title: Trendy Buda
reviews.text: I stayed at art'otel budapest by park plaza on Nov. 1-4, 2007, while travelling with friends in eastern Europe. I found an excellent deal on the property, which made this hotel more than affordable -- early in the fall, Travelzoo offered 3-night stays at a rate of approx. $60/night. All told, I spent about $200, including 3 nights stay, 1 short long-distance call back to Canada, and 2 room-service breakfasts. Incredible!
Last Visit:September 2007
reviews.title: Not a 4 stars hotel

likes.disliked: — Bad front desk staff service and small cramped room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there for 5 nights and was not impressed with the hotel at all (Can't changed hotels because hotels.com didn't let me.) First of all, the hotel claimed to be 4 stars, infact there was nothing 4 stars about it, more like a 2 stars hotel, the room was small and felt cramped. My room was on the second floor and everytime I walk in the hall way all I can small is the grease from the kitchen. The beds where extremely uncomfortable and there were small holes in the bed sheets. The service staff was unfriendly and sexist. I travel with a male partner and the room was registered under my name, yet the whole time my male partner was addressed to, while I have to catch the male receptionist attention and also was given an attitude. I will never recommend this place to anyone, it's not worth the value of your dollar. The only good thing about this hotel is, it's right in front of the Danube River and transportation is convenient and it's in Castle Hill area. Yet there are more hotels on the same street that's worth your money than this one.
reviews.title: What a Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can i say one of the greatest hotels i've ever stayed at.. We had a room that faced the river Danube and it was a beautiful sight every morning. Even though it rained now and again it made our holiday so much more special.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - would go back

likes.liked: — The funky style of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were great, restaurant was lovely along with the bar and the hotel itself was very special. Great value for money what you would pay for a Ibis in London but better than a Hilton.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Definately recommend that if you get the chance stay here for the experience i can't beleive anyone in the world will have a bad experience as long as the hotel carries on doing what they are doing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Shame about the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel in fabulous location. We booked a superior room and the view across The Danube was fantastic. We found the staff very polite and the prices reasonable. The artwork and decor in the hotel was quirky and modern. Would happily go back.
reviews.title: Great hotel, stunning views

reviews.text: A very cool place with a great bathroom and very nicely decorated rooms. The staff were very helpful too. It has a great location on the river, five minutes from the subway and handy for climbing up the
reviews.title: a very cool hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buda hill and for crossing over into Pest. i would say this hotel would be hard to beat in Budapest. My only complaint is that breakfast is extortionate (i think they wanted 15 Euros each) and there's nowhere nice nearby to get your own. We ended up getting a (extremely coffee) from the tiny cafe next door and some pastries from the supermarket opposite the subway. If Cafe Angelika had been open, then this might be a nice place for breakfast. All in all, a thoroughly modern, welcoming and safe place to be
reviews.title: Ultra-modern Hotel with Great Views of Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Art o'tel in Budapest in mid-September 2007 for three nights, and as previous reviewers stated, were offered a Danube view room upgrade. We accepted & the view of the Parliament bldg. especially at night was lovely but it was a bit pricey at 25 euros/night. I would have turned it down if I had realized that the castle view to the rear of the hotel was also very nice.
reviews.title: exactly what we wanted

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, our room was very clean, comfortable and spacious and the bathroom was spotless. It had all the conveniences you could want except CNN or BBC news in English which is a minor issue. Lobby bar provided a nice spot for relaxing in the afternoon & breakfast buffet was excellent. A metro stop is less than 1/2 mile (1 km) away, so traveling by train or metro to the hotel is easy if you are willing to walk a short distance. Location is perfect for the Buda castle and several good cafes are around the corner, plus the Chain Bridge, Pest shopping areas, and Danube river boats for night cruises are an easy 10-15 min. walk away.
reviews.title: Tips on Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a stay at this hotel for three nights. Our room was nice and clean. TV had a menu of channels, and mysteriously, all the English language stations were not working - BBC, CNN, CNBC were listed, and not working. Lots of german channels, french channel, hungarian channels.
reviews.title: Bizarre gaps in service, expensive taxi / bad TV service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the lift, there was a weather guide and we took one look and said, its not raining today - and then realized that the weather guide was a printout from the internet and was a 10 day forecast and it was a week old. Fortunately the weather was better than predicted.
reviews.title: Disappointed ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi service from reception is double the price of standard taxis. A taxi to a night club was costing us 2500 - 3000 forint from reception but when we returned we were paying 1200 - 1500 forint. Taxi to airport was also at least 50% more than taxi from the airport to the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Shame About The Attitude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good buda location - short walk to chain bridge and also a tram stop that runs one stop up to a Metro stop. Advice for Budapest - buy the 1 day travelcard, otherwise you'll just get hassled by the ticket inspectors, and we saw them every day multiple times.
reviews.title: just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were excited to book such a famous hotel with many art works. The lobby was impressive. That's about it. The room (we stayed on the older side) needs some update. It should be modern, but we do not feel it was as clean or neat as other places we stayed at. The beddings are hard, pillows are awful, the towels are hard too.
reviews.title: small houses in the city

description: Striking Hotel set in 4 renovated Baroque houses dating from the 18th century.
